info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 16 at 1:04AM EST until November 16 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Burlington VT
info.description:
* WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch and ice accumulations around a light glaze. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches with localized up to 6 to 8 inches.
* WHERE...Eastern Addison, Essex, and Eastern Rutland Counties.
* WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM EST this morning. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM EST Monday.
* IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall amounts will be dependent on elevation with more snow expected across higher terrain. Watch for rapidly changing road conditions if traveling in mountainous terrain.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest on road conditions in Vermont, visit https://newengland511.org and for New York, visit https://511ny.org.
Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR MIXED PRECIPITATION REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR SNOW FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM EST MONDAY
